channel.title: family on beach road fried toad
channel.description: Recent content in family on beach road fried toad

item.title: North2South Trip 25
item.description: Day one – load the bikes and stop at Latrobe. Reliquaire. Bakery. Bike track. Get to the Ulvy airbnb. Watch the GF. Eat Andycooks chips. After going to The Hive, arrive in Campbell Town for our favourite accommodation of the trip. Discovered our new favourite family game: Sushi Go. A wet day of driving to get to Kingston Beach. Stopping in Hobart for the pool and two of our (Sarah and my) favourite shops; State Cinema Book Shop and Area 52.

item.title: March Long Weekend 25 • Bakers Beach
item.description: A friday evening escape with the pod to Bakers Beach/Narawntpu. Pulled in at about 6:30pm and managed to get a spot. Buddies. Slamwich and Monopoly Deal in the pod. Walter bonding with his new friend ‘Bushy’. Lunch at the Blue Berry Barn Cafe on the way home.

item.title: 20241223 Christmas Eveve
item.description: Taking my new camera, Sony ZV1F for a spin. So good to have a camera with a flip-out screen again.

item.title: Hawley Video ARCHIVE
item.description: A video from 2020. A quick trip to Hawley on my first summer break as an electrical apprentice. One of my favourite sleepy fish tracks on this one. One of my favourite videos I’ve made.

item.title: Coles Bay July 24 Video
item.description: We got away on one of the frostiest weekends of the year to Coles Bay. Shot with the Sigma 35mm 1.4 and ran through the 8mm app.

item.title: Northdown Beach Video
item.description: I installed the latest firmware udpate to my Sony a7iii (with much difficulty) to get the new intervalometer feature. Using it to try out a new video format idea I have had. Put simply, a series of timelapse sequences - all from the same scene. But the timelapses are short interval, around 1 second, longer than your average burst mode yet short enough to cover 10-20 seconds of action. Combining the nostalgic quality of photos and the immersive effect of video.
